intro: Pseudolobivia, commonly known as the ghost cactus, is a member of the Cactaceae family and is native to the arid regions of South America. It is a low-growing, spineless cactus with a distinctive blue-gray coloration that helps it reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. The plant produces yellow flowers during the warm season, adding a striking contrast to its otherwise muted appearance. Pseudolobivia thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for xerophytic gardens. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it a popular choice for desert landscapes and rock gardens.
